page.title: 14Farming:Cardington & Cople
page.content:
The area is a mixture of arable and grassland. The arable is cereals, like wheat and barley; break crops like{oil {seed rape}and fields of potatoes,peas, onions, brussell sprouts and cabbages.
The grassland is mainly used for fattening {sheep }but there is also a herd of beef cattle, but no dairy animals. Some of the grass areas are cut for silage.
The sandy - gravel sub-soil dries very quickly . Most farms now have extensive grids of water pipes fed from streams or reservoirs. {The Lakes {Farm},Cardington has a 10 acre storage pond.
